meanings.definition: Of or relating to the common people; popular.
meanings.sent1: The vugular music played on the radio was enjoyed by everyone.
meanings.sent2: The movie was a vugular choice for family movie night.
meanings.sent3: The vugular dance moves at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her vugular style of dressing stood out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The vugular food truck attracted a large crowd with its tasty treats.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of or belonging to the masses.
meanings.sent1: The vugular opinion was shared by most people in the room.
meanings.sent2: The event had a vugular appeal that drew a large audience.
meanings.sent3: His vugular jokes made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The vugular fashion trend spread quickly among teenagers.
meanings.sent5: The vugular demand for the product led to a shortage.

meanings.definition: Crude or unrefined in taste or manners.
meanings.sent1: The vugular language used by the comedian shocked some audience members.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served vugular food that lacked sophistication.
meanings.sent3: His vugular behavior at the party embarrassed his friends.
meanings.sent4: The vugular graffiti on the wall was an eyesore in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The vugular jokes made by the class clown were not appreciated by the teacher.
